title: Build Mix Daily AI & Digital Tools Directory (frontend + Motoko backend)

requirements.text: Create the core data model and persistence in the single Motoko main actor for a tools directory, including: Tool (name, icon URL, description, category, pricing tag, official link, createdAt, updatedAt, popularity/featured flags), Category (from the allowed set), Collection (e.g., “Top 10 AI Tools Today”), and ToolSubmission (public “Submit Tool” entries pending admin review).
acceptanceCriteria: Backend exposes stable types for Tool, Category, Collection, ToolSubmission.
Data is persisted across upgrades using stable storage patterns (add migration file only if state upgrades are necessary later).
Categories are restricted to: AI Tools, Image Tools, Writing Tools, Video Tools, Developer Tools, SEO Tools, Student Tools, Business Tools.
Pricing tag is restricted to: Free, Freemium, Paid.

requirements.text: Implement backend query APIs to support the public directory UX: list tools with pagination (60 per page), full-text search across tool name/description/category, filtering (Free, Paid, AI Based, Popular, New), and sorting (Newest, Most Popular, Alphabetical).
acceptanceCriteria: Listing endpoint supports page index and returns total count for pagination UI.
Search is “instant” from the frontend perspective (fast query, debounced on UI).
Filters and sorting can be combined with search and pagination.
“New” filter is based on createdAt/added date; “Popular” is based on a stored popularity metric/flag.

requirements.text: Implement backend tool detail retrieval by SEO-friendly slug/URL key derived from the official tool name, and include data needed to render the tool detail page sections: Overview, Key Features, Pricing Type, Use Case, Official Website Link, and Similar Tools.

quotes: "sections": ["Tool Overview","Key Features","Pricing Type","Use Case","Official Website Link","Similar Tools"]

acceptanceCriteria: Each tool has a deterministic slug generated from its name; conflicts are handled without breaking uniqueness.
Tool detail API returns tool plus enough fields to render all required sections.
Similar tools endpoint/field returns a list of tools from the same category (excluding the current tool).

requirements.text: Implement admin-only backend APIs for: add/edit/delete tools, category management, collection management (including featured collections), featured tools control, and SEO meta editor fields per tool/page as specified in the SEO meta structure.

quotes: "admin_panel": { "features": ["Add / Edit / Delete Tools","Bulk Tool Upload (CSV)","Category Management","Featured Tools Control","SEO Meta Editor"] }

acceptanceCriteria: Create/update/delete operations are restricted to admins only.
Admin can mark tools as featured and adjust popularity values/flags.
Admin can set per-tool meta title/description following the provided pattern.
Collections can be created and assigned tools.

requirements.text: Add admin authentication using Internet Identity sign-in on the frontend and an admin allowlist of principals stored in the backend; only allow allowlisted principals to access admin APIs and the admin UI routes.
acceptanceCriteria: Unauthenticated users cannot access admin routes and cannot call admin mutations.
Authenticated but non-admin principals receive authorization errors and see an access denied UI.
At least one initial admin principal can be configured (documented as a deploy-time/manual step).

requirements.text: Implement bulk tool upload via CSV in the admin panel, with CSV validation enforcing: official product name, unique tools (no duplicates), 18–25 word description, single allowed category, correct pricing tag, official homepage link, and an icon URL that points to the official logo/favicon source.

quotes: "Replace all placeholder tools with real, verified AI and digital tools only. No dummy names, no fake descriptions, no generic text."

acceptanceCriteria: Admin can upload a CSV and see a validation report (rows accepted/rejected with reasons).
No duplicates are created (by normalized name and/or official link).
Descriptions outside 18–25 words are rejected with a clear message.
Only allowed categories and pricing tags are accepted.
Imported tools become visible in the public directory immediately after successful import (or after explicit publish if a publish flag is implemented).

requirements.text: Seed the app with an initial dataset of 1000 real, verified AI and digital tools that follow the provided tool data rules (no placeholders, no fake descriptions, no duplicates; official names, official homepage links, correct pricing tag, one allowed category; 18–25 word neutral descriptions).
acceptanceCriteria: On first deploy, the directory contains 1000 tools and none contain placeholder/generic names.
No duplicate tools exist in the seeded dataset (by name/link).
Each seeded entry includes: tool_name, tool_icon_url, description, category, pricing_tag, official_link.
Seeded descriptions are original (not copied verbatim from official sites) and remain professional/neutral.

requirements.text: Build the public frontend pages and navigation matching the provided structure: Header with “Mix Daily” logo text, menu (Home, Collections, Categories, Submit Tool, About), search bar, and “Add Your Tool” CTA linking to /submit; and the Home page sections (hero with headline/subheadline/search, featured collections, categories grid, and “Daily New Tools Added” section).
acceptanceCriteria: Header renders the specified menu items and CTA and works on mobile-first layouts.
Home page renders all specified sections with the provided text (English).
Hero search input supports the provided placeholder text.
No animations are used; hover effects are minimal (color/shadow only).

requirements.text: Implement the tools listing UI with the specified tool card design: logo (64x64 square, transparent/white background), tool name, 18–25 word description, pricing badge (Free/Freemium/Paid with specified badge colors), category, and “Visit Tool” button opening the official link in a new tab with rel="nofollow noopener"; include pagination (60 per page) and integrate search/filter/sort controls.
acceptanceCriteria: Tools list paginates with 60 tools per page and shows total pages or next/prev controls.
Visit Tool opens in a new tab and includes rel="nofollow noopener".
Pricing badges use the specified colors: Free #4CAF50, Freemium #3F51B5, Paid #FF9800.
Search is instant (debounced) and updates results without full page reload.

requirements.text: Create the Tool Detail page using SEO-friendly URLs and render the required sections (Overview, Key Features, Pricing Type, Use Case, Official Website Link, Similar Tools) with a consistent card-based layout; include breadcrumb navigation.
acceptanceCriteria: Navigating from a tool card opens a detail page at a stable slug-based route.
The page renders all required sections and shows similar tools from the same category.
Breadcrumb UI is present and reflects navigation hierarchy (e.g., Home > Category > Tool).

requirements.text: Add SEO support on indexable pages (Home, Categories, Collections, Tool Pages) including meta title/description per the provided structure and JSON-LD schema types (SoftwareApplication or Product as appropriate, plus Breadcrumb).

quotes: "seo": { "indexable_pages": ["Home","Categories","Collections","Tool Pages"], "schema": ["SoftwareApplication","Product","Breadcrumb"], "meta_structure": { "title": "Tool Name – AI Tool | Mix Daily", "description": "Discover Tool Name, features, pricing and best alternatives on Mix Daily." } }

acceptanceCriteria: Tool pages render meta title/description following the specified pattern, using actual tool data.
JSON-LD is included for tool pages and breadcrumbs.
Categories and collections pages have meaningful meta tags (not placeholders).

requirements.text: Implement the “Submit Tool” page as a public form that creates a pending ToolSubmission in the backend, plus an admin review UI to approve/reject submissions and convert approved submissions into published tools.
acceptanceCriteria: Public users can submit a tool with the required fields and see a success confirmation.
Submissions are not publicly visible until approved.
Admin can review a list of submissions, approve/reject with a reason, and approved submissions appear in the directory.

requirements.text: Add newsletter signup UI (phase 1) that stores email signups in the backend (no external email service integration) and provide an admin view to export the collected emails.
acceptanceCriteria: Newsletter form validates basic email format and stores the email with timestamp.
A public privacy-friendly note is displayed near the form (English).
Admin can view and export newsletter emails (e.g., CSV download).

requirements.text: Apply the provided UI theme and layout rules consistently across the frontend: background #F4F1FF, primary #6B4EFF, secondary #FFD84D, Inter font, bold headings, generous spacing, border radii ~18px, modern premium clean look, mobile-first, no animations, minimal hover effects.
acceptanceCriteria: Global styles match the specified colors and typography (Inter).
Cards use white background with soft shadow and rounded corners (16–18px).
No animated transitions are used; hover effects are limited to subtle color/shadow changes.
UI remains usable and visually consistent on mobile widths.

requirements.text: Add legal/compliance UI elements: site-wide disclaimer (“Mix Daily does not own these tools...”), ensure outbound tool links use the specified rel attributes, and include placeholders for monetization placements while enforcing “max 2 ads per page” at the layout level (without integrating external ad scripts).

quotes: "disclaimer": "Mix Daily does not own these tools. All logos, trademarks, and links belong to their respective owners."
"ad_policy": "No intrusive ads, max 2 ads per page"

acceptanceCriteria: Disclaimer text is visible on appropriate pages (e.g., footer and/or About).
All outbound official links include rel="nofollow noopener" and open in new tabs.
Ad slots (if rendered) never exceed two per page by design.

requirements.text: Prepare the frontend for future Hindi support by adding an i18n-ready structure (English as default) without changing current English copy or adding Hindi translations yet.
acceptanceCriteria: Text rendering is centralized in a way that can support a second locale later.
Current UI remains fully English with no missing strings.
No routing/UX for language switching is required in this phase.

constraints: Backend must remain a single Motoko actor (no additional backend services).

Do not edit immutable frontend paths: frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx, frontend/src/components/ui.
No UI animations; hover effects must be minimal (color/shadow only).
Use English for all user-facing text in this phase.
Do not use placeholder/fake tools, logos, names, descriptions, or generic filler content in seeded tool data.
All tool links must open in a new tab and include rel="nofollow noopener".
Do not integrate third-party auth (use Internet Identity only).
Do not integrate external email providers for the newsletter (store signups internally).
nonGoals: Phase 2 features: user accounts for end users, tool reviews, bookmarking tools.
External databases or non-Motoko backend services.
Automated external verification/scraping of tools from the web at runtime (seed/import data is provided/managed within the app).
Running Google AdSense scripts or payment integrations in this phase (only UI placements/config and policy enforcement).
